column5: Cal and I got back out to Simcoe, and brought my little cousin Brent along this time.  Being so calm today, the main lake was open to fish and we werent so restricted to the north end.  We all started dragging tubes, and Brent picked up his first Simcoe smallie, about a 4 pounder.    We got onto some good fish in deep water, 32-42 feet fishing breaklines on a mid lake shoal. Most came on tubes and jigging spoons.   Brent with his first Simcoe experience.   Me and my cousin show some off   Cal, the spoon master.
PIGS!!!!!
looks like a great time,congrats on those fish
nice bass! those are some fall fatties
Congrats...nice fish, and you are all looking so happy.
some great bass there
Hey Steve, I feel the same way about your Simcoe posts as you do about my steelhead posts  . Nice fish dude!
....Impressive....
some real hawgs!
Those are some nice toads.
I,ll take four of them this Sunday Steve.  Nice fishes boys.
we'll take 4 as well haha, ill be in calgary til sat night, hopefully my flights not delayed, i'll be pretty tired fishin that tourney.
Very nice Simcoe smallies!  WTG  Aaron
Thanks guys,  I will add that there is a tournament put on by the Barrie Bassmasters on Sunday October 21.  It is 120/team I believe, launch is at Tiffin St in Barrie. 730 blastoff
8 am blast off. Man and you belong to the club. HAHA Guess we,ll finally meet.LOL Barrie is SO big .
its gettin there Brian, thats for sure, havent seen you out prefishing, but then again Simcoe is SO big

Some great looking smallies.  Congrats!  One question - how far south in Lake Simcoe (roughly) can you catch decent smallies like that?  I'm guessing renting a boat from the south end (Cooks Bay/Barrie) means a long boat ride? (I guess that's two questions! LOL  007
Very nice, good job !!!!

cooks bay is relatively close to good smallie fishing, once you pass roaches point, you're there.  cooks also has trophy largies (saw an 8 pounder caught there this summer by a 14 year old from shore) and trophy pike.
You know you can have 120 boats on simcoe and maybe see 2-3 boats all day.  When Im out prefishing,I push the invisable wonder women plane button.
Nice bag of smallies.!!One question.... Whats a breakline????

A breakline is where the depth changes relatively quickly.  Eg. "I fished the 20-25  foot breakline"  A breakline can be gradual but it's usually the one's where the depth drops quickly that fish associate with.  Nice Smallies too, btw.  Good luck in the tournament fellas.
Oh so its the line of a drop off? Thanks!
Yeah, drop off = breakline
